Articles.Content:
I figured since this is more a general question, I'd rather ask here than in the Toolbar (Blizzy78) thread. At least until I have something to ask him about specifically.

Anyway, I have a "small" collection of mods installed, including Blizzy78's Toolbar. Now some stock icons in the mission environment (like credits/science/reputation) are permanently hidden, as well as some mod icons (like Infernal Robotics). I gathered which icons can be shown in Toolbar depends on the individual mod maker but there is one thing I haven't figured out:

How can I remove mod icons from the stock toolbar and have them show up in Blizzy78's version instead (provided they support this)?

I figured that freeing up slots in the stock toolbar would get the now hidden ones back.

Complete mod list (latest folder names + actual mod if relevant):

Spoiler

000_Toolbar

000_USITools

GravityTurn (icon)

KAS

KER (icon)

KIS

KOS (icon)

KWCommunityFixes

KWRocketry

MagicSmokeIndustries (icon, Infernal Robotics)

ModRocketSys

ProceduralFairings

ProceduralParts

RemoteTech

SCANsat (icon)

SpaceY-lifters

StockBugFixPlus

TriggerTech (icon, Kerbal Alarm Clock)

TweakScale-master

UmbraSpaceIndustries (Sounding Rockets)

If there are alternatives to Blizzy's Toolbar that lets me have all the stock icons while also have all the mod icons available in some form, please chime in. If there is a fix for the original question, even better.

Edited March 18, 2016 by LN400

51 minutes ago, LN400 said:

How can I remove mod icons from the stock toolbar and have them show up in Blizzy78's version instead (provided they support this)?

I figured that freeing up slots in the stock toolbar would get the now hidden ones back.

First off, the stock toolbar scrolls so the "missing" icons are just off the end.  Hit the little arrow button at the end of the stock toolbar to scroll the icons until you see what you're looking for.  It took me a long time to realize this myself, so don't feel bad if you haven't noticed this feature

Now, as to removing mods icons from the stock toolbar.  AFAIK, this depends entirely on the mod.  Some like MJ let you do this, others do not.  So basically, check the settings options for each and every mod you have individual and see if there's an option for this.  If not, then you're stuck with it.

25 minutes ago, Geschosskopf said:

First off, the stock toolbar scrolls so the "missing" icons are just off the end.  Hit the little arrow button at the end of the stock toolbar to scroll the icons until you see what you're looking for.  It took me a long time to realize this myself, so don't feel bad if you haven't noticed this feature

Now, as to removing mods icons from the stock toolbar.  AFAIK, this depends entirely on the mod.  Some like MJ let you do this, others do not.  So basically, check the settings options for each and every mod you have individual and see if there's an option for this.  If not, then you're stuck with it.

Perhaps I'm blind but I really can't see any arrow button. I hovered over the entire toolbar area but nothing popped up. This image shows my entire toolbar.

4 hours ago, LN400 said:

Perhaps I'm blind but I really can't see any arrow button. I hovered over the entire toolbar area but nothing popped up. This image shows my entire toolbar.

Did you look over next to the altimeter?
As @Geschosskopf said, it depends entirely on the mod.  Check to see if any of the mods have a settings menu, or anything that says disable stock toolbar.
